ratings.comment: Dr. Shank is a genius who is so incredibly passionate about what he teaches. Sometimes he'll go off on tangents & lecture really isn't necessary, but he's such a nice guy who's always willing to help. Took us on a cool planetarium field trip. Gives you the whole exam in advance (all potential essaysID terms). I'd recommend him for sure!

Interesting. Very helpful in office hours. Super nice guy. Loves what he does. Very little work until exam week. Can skip every lecture and go to discussion and still get a decent grade. Don't need to do hw, unless leading discussion. Subjective exam grading. Boring lectures, but fascinating info. Blow off class for 75% of the semester.

Prof. Shank obviously knows his stuff, but his lectures are pretty disorganized and a little boring. There are three mid-term exams, all of which require a lot of memorizing and little that you are actually tested on. But the good news is that he gives you study guides that have everything you need to know on them, so no curve balls.

3 exams. Lectures are boring and extremely vague. For someone uninterested in the field the class was hard. Very philosophical and hard to wrap your head around. Beware if you sign up for this course.
Lectures are pretty straightforward, and an outline is always emailed to you. Discussions are mandatory, but laid back. Review session attendance and reading will get you a good exam grade.

Shank could benefit from some "how to give a lecture" seminars. Every other word was "uh" and his outlines were far too general to be helpful. He was jumbled and didn't speak as if he was teaching material (he spoke as if we already knew what he was lecturing on, which is pointless). Moreover, the readings were just as confusing as the lectures.

This is a hard class, definitely. But Shank is a great Pro. and he is very kind and willing to help everyone. Follow him in the materials and try to communicate with him. work hard and believe me you can get A. ( I am an international student and freshman.)

I thoroughly enjoyed both Prof Shank and the class. He is very passionate about the subject and makes you interested too. Lectures are interesting if you pay attention. Overall one of the best professors I've had.

Mike is a standup guy. He is very intelligent and knows a lot about history of science. He gives students great opportunities to learn (e.g. star gazing, planetarium trips) but students take this for granted. You get out of this class what you put in. Sometimes he may digress but his anecdotes help relate the information. Highly recommended!!!

Having just graduated from UW (and having attended 2 institutions prior), I can say that Professor Shank was my favorite instructor in college. Great man, expert in his field, and incredibly personable and interesting. He can sometimes get caught up in minute details that are irrelevant to the tests but overall a great Professor.

Shank is very passionate about his subject, but he digresses from the main point of his lectures far too often and takes away valuable class time. By the end, I wrote about half a page of notes per lecture before he went off on some wild tangent about things that wouldn't be on the exam and failed to garner my interest. A poor professor overall.
Outstanding professor, tough but fair. Not a good call for a blow-off easy "A," but Prof. Shank is an excellent professor and an even better person.
Did not like this class...very boring and hard to sit through.  The professor's cool though and seems very passionate about the subject...he just wasn't able to make the class very interesting.

Trust me, if you got a good TA and study hard before exam you will get an easy A just like me!! His lecture is okay, not funny or boring. I am a international student, but I am really enjoy this class.

zzzzzzzz... This is not an astronomy class, but Shank will try to make it one.  Way too many divergences from what's important and the tests were not useful at all as the strategy is "how many insignificant ancient people can I cram into my brain?"  I thought it would be an interesting course, but was a snoozer.  Good try Shank, but zzzzzzzzzzzzzzz
Shank is a really nice guy who's passionate about what he teaches.  Though he gets too in-depth at times, I really enjoyed the class and it's easy too.

Nice guy, interested in his students, fair grader, and explains things well.  Easily sidetracked though (which can obscure what's important, hence the hit on clarity), a bit boring at times, and dwells on a few too many insignificant details.
The Shankster is a great guy. Stop by his office hours and say hi. Dont trust the previous comments I know many people who have taken his courses and love them...
It was interesting to learn about science from a different point of view. Presentation of material can be dry at times, but overall class is good and Shank is a nice guy.
Boring class - hard to sit through.   TA saves the day and ACTUALLY explains things.
